tool_description: Creates and manages scheduled maintenance plans for updating database statistics based on analysis results and system requirements.

analysis_results.description: JSON string from Statistics Analysis Engine containing analysis results

maintenance_window_start.description: Start time for maintenance window in HH:MM format (24-hour)

maintenance_window_end.description: End time for maintenance window in HH:MM format (24-hour)

timezone.description: Timezone for maintenance window (e.g., UTC, EST, PST)

max_concurrent_jobs.description: Maximum number of concurrent statistics update jobs (1-10)

priority_order.description: Priority order for updates (high_growth, stale, unused_indexes)

exclude_weekends.description: Whether to exclude weekends from scheduled maintenance

error_messages: Invalid analysis results: Analysis results must be valid JSON from Statistics Analysis Engine.
Invalid time format: Use HH:MM format for maintenance window times.
Invalid timezone: Provide a valid timezone identifier.
Invalid maintenance window: End time must be after start time.
Invalid concurrent jobs: Must be between 1-10 concurrent jobs.
Invalid priority order: Use valid priority types [high_growth, stale, unused_indexes].
usage: Provide analysis_results, maintenance_window_start/end, and timezone to create maintenance schedule. Optionally adjust max_concurrent_jobs, priority_order, and exclude_weekends based on system constraints.

schedule_id.description: Unique identifier for the created maintenance schedule

scheduled_jobs.description: List of scheduled jobs with timestamps and targets

estimated_duration.description: Estimated total duration for all maintenance jobs

next_execution.description: Timestamp of the next scheduled execution
